answers.answer: Difficult to say without evaluation.  Many of the major diseases have been thought of and ruled out already.  I agree with the workup for diabetes, thyroid and Cushing's syndrome.  Although for the latter disease, a 24-hr urine cortisol level is the best test for diagnosis and should be considered if not done.It is unlikely that the injection of steroids would be a factor, since little of the steroid is absorbed systemically with the shots.A referral to a dietician to document caloric intake can be considered.  Otherwise, I agree with a referral to an endocrinologist.  A proper diagnosis should be discussed with your personal physician so the referral can be approved.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.kevinmd_

question: Hi there,I am 39y/o female who needs to lose about 60lbs.  Almost all of it is in my abdominal area and breasts.  I gained this weight after 6 months on bedrest during my pregnancy, with most of it gained in the last 3 months of the pregnancy.  I haven't lost any. I eat healthy (about 1500cals/day).  I eat fresh produce, lean meat, egg whites, lentils for protein. NO sugar (don't really crave sweets) and avoid transfatty acids.  I power walk 45 - 60min, 4-5x week, plus calesthenics.  I can't do weight lifting exercises since I have a long history of benign PVC's, and they make the PVC's worse.Other symptoms I have are muscle spasmsMy chiropractor says I have muscle knots everywhere.  I also take Klonopin for the PVC's when they are bad.2 wks ago, I had a Kenalog shot for allergies.  I have had them before(more than 10yrs ago). It helped the allergies, but I am one week late for my period (and I'm never late! - also not pregnant). I don't even know if it will come.  I also had a bad headache the night of the injection. I also feel fatter, my pants slightly tighter around my waist.I also had steroid shots when I was pregnant (3.3 yrs ago)for baby's lungs.  They made me tense and complete insomniac for several nites.  I also had a steroid shot in each of my feet for neuroma 1.5yrs ago.In the last three years, my dr. has checked my thyroid repeatedly.  It is always normal, not even low normal.  He also did another test for cortisol, where I had to take a low dose steroid pill and have a blood test the next morning.  That was normal too.  My gyno did a group of blood tests for insulin resistance, but that was normal.  My glucose is great.  I do have mild sleep apnea, but I have been on CPAP for several months, and feel energetic.  He is at a loss at this point- wanted to send me to endocrinologist, but HMO won't go for it without a dx.
title: Unable to lose weight with exercise/diet post childbirth & steroid question
